segments.text: I see the woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor, which is shocking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just ignoring it or really doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to no good, but she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in her own little world right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how unaware she is of the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone tells her before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her because she’s going to be in for a big surprise when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR
